wikipedia_page.main: William Campbell Sleigh (1818– 23 January 1887) was an English lawyer and politician. He became a serjeant-at-law in 1868, the last person received into Serjeants' Inn who was not a judge.

response: Other notable 19th-century residents include William Campbell Sleigh, lawyer and politician, and diplomat and MP Edward Eastwick, both of whom retired to and died in Ventnor.  The admiral Earl Jellicoe also retired there.  The organist and composer Edwin Lemare was born and spent his early childhood in Ventnor.  The composer Edward Elgar and Caroline Alice Elgar spent three weeks on honeymoon there in 1889.
* Counsel for Arthur Orton, alias Roger Tichborne, taking over the brief from William Campbell Sleigh in April 1873.
*William Campbell Sleigh (1818–1887), English lawyer and politician
